description: Manage DNS Resolver Policy (DNS Security Policy).

commands.name: az dns-resolver policy create
commands.syntax:
az dns-resolver policy create --dns-resolver-policy-name
                              --resource-group
                              [--if-match]
                              [--if-none-match]
                              [--location]
                              [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                              [--tags]
examples: az dns-resolver policy create --resource-group sampleResourceGroup --dns-resolver-policy-name sampleDnsResolverPolicy --location westus2 --tags "{key1:value1}"

commands.name: az dns-resolver policy delete
commands.summary: Delete a DNS resolver policy. WARNING: This operation cannot be undone.
commands.syntax:
az dns-resolver policy delete [--dns-resolver-policy-name]
                              [--ids]
                              [--if-match]
                              [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                              [--resource-group]
                              [--subscription]
                              [--yes]
examples: az dns-resolver policy delete --resource-group sampleResourceGroup --dns-resolver-policy-name sampleDnsResolverPolicy

commands.name: az dns-resolver policy list
commands.summary: List DNS resolver policies in all resource groups of a subscription.

commands.name: az dns-resolver policy show
commands.summary: Get properties of a DNS resolver policy.
examples: az dns-resolver policy show --resource-group sampleResourceGroup --dns-resolver-policy-name sampleDnsResolverPolicy

commands.name: az dns-resolver policy update
commands.syntax:
az dns-resolver policy update [--add]
                              [--dns-resolver-policy-name]
                              [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                              [--ids]
                              [--if-match]
                              [--if-none-match]
                              [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                              [--remove]
                              [--resource-group]
                              [--set]
                              [--subscription]
                              [--tags]
examples: az dns-resolver policy create --resource-group sampleResourceGroup --dns-resolver-policy-name sampleDnsResolverPolicy --location westus2 --tags "{key2:value2}"

commands.name: az dns-resolver policy wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
